results.title: Festival in Adelaide
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, Richard Mason, Loch Townsend, Malcolm Otton, Maslyn Williams, Stanley Hawes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows something of the preparation that went into the Adelaide Festival of Arts 1962, and excerpts from the performances themselves. General notes: AFI Award: silver award (documentary) 1963.

results.title: Father
results.creator_credit: John Power, Damien Parer, Leftbank Productions and Barron Films
results.brief_description: Internationally renowned Max von Sydow heads a cast of acclaimed actors, including Carol Drinkwater, Julia Blake and Steve Jacobs, in this powerfully moving film. It tells the story of a family whose lives are shattered when their elderly father is accused of being a Nazi war criminal. Torn between family love and loyalty and the devastating realities of wartime Nazi Germany, all relationships are tested to the limit. Photography by Dan Burstall. AFI Awards were won by Max von Sydow and Julia Blake.

results.title: Rear Window [DVD]
results.brief_description: A freelance travelling news photographer with a broken leg is confined in his Greenwich Village apartment during a New York heatwave. A voyeuristic impulse leads him from curiosity to suspicion of murder as he observes his neighbours in the apartments opposite.

constellations_other.name: Suburbia and surveillance
constellations_other.description: Tru-Vue and View-Masters allow users to look through view finders and discover new worlds and perspectives, something also explored through many films and TV shows, where watching often reveals secrets, truth and even illusions.

constellations_other.name: Suburban scenes (Lisa McCune)
constellations_other.description: Lisa McCune is best known for her role as Constable Maggie Doyle in the television series Blue Heelers (1994–2006). In addition to showing the day-to-day lives of police in a small Victorian town, the series explores the various dynamics of suburbia—a theme present throughout the whole of screen media.

results.description: A freelance travelling news photographer with a broken leg is confined in his Greenwich Village apartment during a New York heatwave. A voyeuristic impulse leads him from curiosity to suspicion of murder as he observes his neighbours in the apartments opposite. His morbid curiosity is marked by a switch from binoculars to a telephoto lens as he watches a ‘silent’ film of other people’s lives. To Hitchcock it was the visual construction of a mental process, ‘the epitome of the subjective treatment’. Cast includes James Stewart, Grace Kelly, Wendell Corey, Thelma Ritter. Screenplay by John Michael Hayes based on a the short story by Cornell Woolrich. Photography by Robert Burks. Music by Franz Waxman.

Screenplay by John Michael Hayes based on a the short story by Cornell Woolrich. Photography by Robert Burks. Music by Franz Waxman.

results.title: Ferris Bueller's day off [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Hughes, Tom Jacobson and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A 1961 Ferrari 250 GT California. It was one man’s love, his passion, and his fault he didn’t lock the garage when Ferris Bueller wanted the day off. One day, towards the end of his senior year, Ferris (Matthew Broderick), cuts school and heads for downtown Chicago with his girl Sloane and his best friend Cameron, to show what a little ingenuity, a lot of nerve, and a red Ferrari can do. From John Hughes comes a contemporary comedy which follows Ferris’ wildly audacious and nearly flawless plan to take it easy. Featuring a soundtrack from artists including Yello, Big Audio Dynamite, Sigue Sigue Sputnik, The Beat, The Beatles and The Dream Academy. Also stars Alan Ruck and Mia Sara. Cinematography, Tak Fujimoto. Script, John Hughes.

results.title: Ferret keeping
results.brief_description: This video covers the basics of ferret management and breeding for those keeping ferrets for working, racing, or as pets. Advice on choosing a ferret, types of housing, and what to feed them. The video follows a kit (baby ferret), from birth to its care at different ages, and covers how to train, handle and breed. The video explores the myth of ferrets being aggressive animals, revealing how engaging and good-natured they can be. Presented by James McKay, zoologist, writer, broadcaster, and internationally acknowledged as one of the world’s leading authorities on ferrets.

results.title: FernGully: the Last rainforest
results.creator_credit: Bill Kroyer, Peter Faiman, Wayne Young, Youngheart Productions and FAI Films
results.brief_description: Dedicated to “our children and our children’s children” the magical, mystical world of Fern Gully, the last rainforest takes us to a secret, special place filled with wonder and adventure where human beings exist only in fairy tales! Human hero Zak, shrunk to fairy size by Crysta joins Batty Koda, an escapee from a human lab and the denizens of the forest as they struggle to save the future of the forest from the evil enemy Hexxus. Voices include Tim Curry, Christian Slater and Robin Williams.

results.title: Fern the red deer
results.creator_credit: Jan Darnley-Smith, Adrian Worker, Children's Film and Television Foundation and De Lane Lea
results.brief_description: Fern the red deer A marvellous adventure story, filmed on location in remote Exmoor, about an abandoned deer calf. The deer calf forms a bond with two young children and together they fight for the wild deer’s survival.

results.title: Femmes de Personne = Nobody's Women
results.brief_description:
Isabelle, Adeline and Cecile work in a radiology practice. Disappointed by relationships with men, they content themselves with chance encounters. In this indulgent piece on mid-life crisis in the middle classe, the male characters are presented as a collection of irresponsible, self-centred creatures while women battle to come to term with the great decisions in life such as child bearing and rearing, with force booze and cigarettes for solace.

Credits: Producer, Alain Terzian ; director, Christopher Frank ; writer, Christopher Frank ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Marthe Keller, Jean-Louis Trintignant, Caroline Cellier, Fanny Cottencon, Philippe Leotard.

results.title: Femme fatale [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Marina Gefter, Tarak Ben Ammar and Quinta Communications
results.brief_description: Brian de Palma’s exciting and kinetic celebration of cinema has a frankly ludicrous plot involving diamond smugglers, a violent, beautiful and ruthless lesbian anti-heroine, and an audaciously over-the-top climax. But none of that matters for this strikingly shot film, beginning at the actual 2001 Cannes Film Festival and culminating in a breathlessly executed finale on the streets of Paris, is a joyful celebration of the possibilities of action cinema. De Palma has always been one of Hitchcock’s staunchest heirs and “Femme fatale” is a continuation of that master’s pleasure in creating a virtuoso cinema of spectacle, technique and purely cinematic language. From the sharpness of Bill Pankow’s editing to the sublime use of split-screen and subjective camera, from the clever pastiche of Ryuichi Sakamoto’s score to the crisp cinematography of Theirry Arbogast, “Femme fatale” is a film in love with cinema itself. Rebecca Romijn-Stamos makes for a suitably sexy and dangerous noir heroine; Antonio Banderas is the mug who falls in love with her; and there are guest cameos by Cannes Film Festival director, Gilles Jacob, by French director Regis Wargnier and French actress, Sandrine Bonnaire.
